1313.description: As introduced, requires public and private schools to provide students in grade 12 information on how to register to vote, how to vote in an election using a ballot, and how to vote using an absentee ballot; allows schools to provide this information through activities, written materials, internet resources, mock elections, and any other method chosen by the principal after consultation with teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 50 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

1315.description: As enacted, removes requirement that agencies receiving public funding to assist businesses with sales volumes of $200,000 or less, or with fewer than 15 employees, must annually file a report with the department detailing the agencies' success with assisting such businesses; removes requirement that the office of minority business enterprise, or other division, must file a report with the commissioner compiling the agencies' filed data and must annually report the results of the data to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.

1321.description: As enacted, defines "municipality" for purposes of the authorization for a municipality to create the office of administrative hearing officer to hear building and property maintenance code violations to mean any incorporated town or city, or metropolitan form of government; adds "locally adopted zoning codes" to the codes over which administrative hearing officer has jurisdiction. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54, Part 10.

1881.title: As enacted, authorizes the Tennessee athletic commission to authorize international qualifying events for kickboxing to occur in this state as long as the events meet the standards required for such events by the World Association of Kickboxing Organizations or any subsequent entity recognized as the official kickboxing governing body by the International World Games Association. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 115.
1881.description: As enacted, authorizes the Tennessee athletic commission to authorize international qualifying events for kickboxing to occur in this state as long as the events meet the standards required for such events by the World Association of Kickboxing Organizations or any subsequent entity recognized as the official kickboxing governing body by the International World Games Association. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 115.

1882.title: As enacted, clarifies that the present law that exempts certain oils containing cannabidiol and used for research or treatment of seizures or epilepsy will not be repealed on June 30, 2018. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 43.
1882.description: As enacted, clarifies that the present law that exempts certain oils containing cannabidiol and used for research or treatment of seizures or epilepsy will not be repealed on June 30, 2018. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 43.

1883.description: As introduced, requires a person who holds a valid certificate of registration as a locksmith apprentice for four or more years to apply for licensure as a locksmith; reduces continuing education requirements for locksmiths. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11 and Title 62, Chapter 35.

1886.description: As introduced, exempts water furnished by a utility district and used exclusively in a farming operation from sales and use tax. - Amends TCA Title 67.

1893.description: As enacted, designates the state colleges of applied technology at Chattanooga as part of the statewide system of state colleges of applied technology and authorizes the board of regents to establish additional state colleges of applied technology or to combine existing state colleges of applied technology as needed to improve operational and administrative efficiencies. - Amends TCA Title 49.

1897.description: As introduced, prohibits a member or commissioner of a utility board from being an employee of the utility, an elected official, or having an immediate family member who is an employee of the utility. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 65.

1904.description: As enacted, administratively attaches the David Crockett commission to the department of finance and administration; creates a separate account within the treasury to be used to erect a monument; authorizes state and private funds to be used to erect a monument with intent that no state funds be used until private funding exhausted. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 8, Part 4.

1924.description: As introduced, requires the commissioner of mental health and substance abuse services to study issues relating to the need for revisions to statutes governing mandatory outpatient treatment in light of the experience of the pilot project concerning assisted outpatient treatment under Tennessee Code Annotated, Section 33-6-624 and to report the findings and recommendations of the study to the health committee of the house of representatives and the health and welfare committee of the senate on or before January 15, 2019. - Amends TCA Title 33.

1925.title: As enacted, provides that a real property owner who prevails in an action challenging the validity of a lien, including in a slander of title proceeding, will recover the person's reasonable attorney's fees, reasonable costs, liquidated damages in an amount equal to 10 percent of the fair market value of the property not to exceed $100,000, and actual damages incurred by the owner; excludes actions brought to challenge lien based on loan agreement for which the encumbered property was listed as collateral to secure the repayment of a loan. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 47; Title 66 and Title 71.
1925.description: As enacted, provides that a real property owner who prevails in an action challenging the validity of a lien, including in a slander of title proceeding, will recover the person's reasonable attorney's fees, reasonable costs, liquidated damages in an amount equal to 10 percent of the fair market value of the property not to exceed $100,000, and actual damages incurred by the owner; excludes actions brought to challenge lien based on loan agreement for which the encumbered property was listed as collateral to secure the repayment of a loan. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 47; Title 66 and Title 71.

1937.title: As enacted, specifies that a person who is an honorably discharged veteran of the United States armed forces, a member of the Tennessee national guard, a member of the Tennessee air national guard, or an inactive reservist of any of the United States uniformed military services in good standing must not be disqualified as a candidate for any office if, for service-related reasons, that person was unable to comply with a statewide political party's or recognized minor party's rules for candidacy for nomination for such party, and such service-related reasons are the sole reason the person is unable to qualify. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 13, Part 1.
1937.description: As enacted, specifies that a person who is an honorably discharged veteran of the United States armed forces, a member of the Tennessee national guard, a member of the Tennessee air national guard, or an inactive reservist of any of the United States uniformed military services in good standing must not be disqualified as a candidate for any office if, for service-related reasons, that person was unable to comply with a statewide political party's or recognized minor party's rules for candidacy for nomination for such party, and such service-related reasons are the sole reason the person is unable to qualify. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 13, Part 1.

2519.description: As enacted, prohibits a sentencing court from making a sentencing determination based in whole or in part on defendant’s consent or refusal to consent to any form of temporary or permanent birth control, sterilization, or family planning services regardless of whether the defendant’s consent is voluntarily given; prohibits courts accepting a guilty plea agreement or plea of nolo contendere, or imposing a sentence, if any part of the plea or sentence is in whole or in part conditioned or based upon the criminal defendant submitting to any form of temporary or permanent birth control, sterilization, or family planning services, regardless of whether the defendant's consent is voluntarily given. - Amends TCA Title 40.

2681.description: As enacted, requires the governor, in appointing members to the board of regents, to strive to ensure that at least one board member is an honorably discharged military veteran; requires that in making appointments to the state university boards and UT board of regents the governor strive to ensure members are diverse in honorable military service in addition to gender, race, perspective, and experience. - Amends TCA Section 49-8-201 and Section 49-9-202.

2722.description: Subject to local approval, authorizes property owners that do not live in the city to vote in city elections; removes disability for six months as a reason for the vacancy of the office of mayor or councilman; permanently prohibits persons convicted of certain crimes from holding office; creates process for electing a council member if the council is unable to appoint one in the event of a vacancy; authorizes the city to donate or contribute funds in accordance with state law; renames the city clerk and recorder the city recorder; changes provisions related to purchasing and the sale of city property; makes other revisions to the charter. - Amends Chapter 121 of the Private Acts of 2004; as amended.

2725.title: As introduced, establishes that it is not an offense for a veteran who has been awarded the Purple Heart to possess less than 0.5 ounces of marijuana if the person retains proof of the awarding of the Purple Heart and a recommendation from a licensed doctor regarding the medical use of marijuana. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
2725.description: As introduced, establishes that it is not an offense for a veteran who has been awarded the Purple Heart to possess less than 0.5 ounces of marijuana if the person retains proof of the awarding of the Purple Heart and a recommendation from a licensed doctor regarding the medical use of marijuana. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

2729.description: As introduced, specifies that the state board of education is the LEA for those charter schools that it authorizes. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

2731.title: As introduced, requires commissioner of general services to prepare a report of all state departments and agencies utilizing energy savings performance contracting to reduce energy and water use in state buildings; requires the commissioner to transmit the report electronically to the governor and each member of the general assembly no later than January 15, 2019. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 12.
2731.description: As introduced, requires commissioner of general services to prepare a report of all state departments and agencies utilizing energy savings performance contracting to reduce energy and water use in state buildings; requires the commissioner to transmit the report electronically to the governor and each member of the general assembly no later than January 15, 2019. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 12.

2732.title: As introduced, prohibits LEAs from entering into a non-disclosure agreement during, or as a prerequisite to, settlement for any act of sexual misconduct; prohibits employees from assisting others in obtaining employment if the employee knows that the person has engaged in sexual misconduct involving a minor or student. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
2732.description: As introduced, prohibits LEAs from entering into a non-disclosure agreement during, or as a prerequisite to, settlement for any act of sexual misconduct; prohibits employees from assisting others in obtaining employment if the employee knows that the person has engaged in sexual misconduct involving a minor or student. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

2733.title: As introduced, requires governing boards of state institutions of higher education to adopt policies addressing management of student debts or obligations owed directly to the state institutions; removes a requirement that state institutions withhold diplomas, certificates of credit, or grade reports if the student has an outstanding debt to the institution of more than $25.00. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Section 49-9-108.
2733.description: As introduced, requires governing boards of state institutions of higher education to adopt policies addressing management of student debts or obligations owed directly to the state institutions; removes a requirement that state institutions withhold diplomas, certificates of credit, or grade reports if the student has an outstanding debt to the institution of more than $25.00. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Section 49-9-108.

2734.title: As introduced, requires a municipality financing the cost of a qualified public use facility in a tourism development zone to provide notice, within five days instead of seven days, before entering into any structured lease agreement, that discloses the purpose of the agreement. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 88 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
2734.description: As introduced, requires a municipality financing the cost of a qualified public use facility in a tourism development zone to provide notice, within five days instead of seven days, before entering into any structured lease agreement, that discloses the purpose of the agreement. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 88 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

2736.description: As introduced, requires agencies, when statutorily required to hold a public hearing as part of their rulemaking process, to make copies of the rule available in redline form to persons in attendance at the hearing. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.

2737.description: As introduced, authorizes the board of trustees of the college savings trust fund program to seek rulings from the department of treasury and internal revenue service about the program. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 8.

2738.title: As introduced, specifies that tenant must provide written notice to landlord when changing an email address at which the tenant agrees to receive notice from the landlord. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 13, Chapter 20; Title 33; Title 39; Title 44, Chapter 17; Title 44, Chapter 8, Part 4 and Title 66.
2738.description: As introduced, specifies that tenant must provide written notice to landlord when changing an email address at which the tenant agrees to receive notice from the landlord. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 13, Chapter 20; Title 33; Title 39; Title 44, Chapter 17; Title 44, Chapter 8, Part 4 and Title 66.

2739.title: As introduced, authorizes a partial fill of a prescription of an opioid. - Amends TCA Title 53 and Title 63.
2739.description: As introduced, authorizes a partial fill of a prescription of an opioid. - Amends TCA Title 53 and Title 63.

2741.title: As introduced, requires the department to use existing knowledge and volunteer personnel to provide training to members of municipal solid waste management region boards. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

2743.title: As introduced, extends from 30 days to 40 days the period of advance notice that licensed child-placing agencies and licensed clinical social workers must provide the department before increasing fees charged to prospective adoptive parents. - Amends TCA Title 36.
2743.description: As introduced, extends from 30 days to 40 days the period of advance notice that licensed child-placing agencies and licensed clinical social workers must provide the department before increasing fees charged to prospective adoptive parents. - Amends TCA Title 36.

2747.description: As introduced, requires the commissioner of commerce and insurance to study issues related to including screening for the hepatitis C virus as a part of preventive services or as a mandated health insurance benefit for health insurance entities regulated by the department including consideration of the benefits and costs of broad based or targeted screening for the hepatitis C virus; the commissioner shall report to the health committee of the house of representatives and the health and welfare committee of the senate on or before January 15, 2019. - Amends TCA Title 56.

2749.title: As introduced, removes penalty of Class A misdemeanor for refusing to consent to breath or blood test for DUI; makes various revisions to DUI law regarding breath and blood tests. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13; Title 40, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.
2749.description: As introduced, removes penalty of Class A misdemeanor for refusing to consent to breath or blood test for DUI; makes various revisions to DUI law regarding breath and blood tests. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13; Title 40, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

2761.title: As introduced, allows Sevier County, upon the adoption of a resolution by a two-thirds majority vote of the county legislative body, to assess a privilege tax on litigation in court cases in an amount not to exceed $100 per case to be used exclusively for the construction of a building to house legal proceedings and offices directly involved with the court system, and to renovate the county courthouse. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 6.
2761.description: As introduced, allows Sevier County, upon the adoption of a resolution by a two-thirds majority vote of the county legislative body, to assess a privilege tax on litigation in court cases in an amount not to exceed $100 per case to be used exclusively for the construction of a building to house legal proceedings and offices directly involved with the court system, and to renovate the county courthouse. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 6.

2763.title: As introduced, allows current or former members of the national guard and the military reserve forces to obtain handgun permit at age 18; makes consistent the effect that restoration of citizenship has upon the possession and purchase of firearms and the obtaining of a handgun carry permit. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
2763.description: As introduced, allows current or former members of the national guard and the military reserve forces to obtain handgun permit at age 18; makes consistent the effect that restoration of citizenship has upon the possession and purchase of firearms and the obtaining of a handgun carry permit. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

2768.title: As introduced, requires that a state employee in the preferred service be reinstated upon the failure of an appointing authority or the commissioner of human resources to issue a timely decision in a Step I or Step II appeal, respectively; requires the appointing authority and commissioner in such proceedings to provide the complainant employee copies of certain evidence prior to meeting with the employee; excludes evidence from consideration if not so provided. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30.
2768.description: As introduced, requires that a state employee in the preferred service be reinstated upon the failure of an appointing authority or the commissioner of human resources to issue a timely decision in a Step I or Step II appeal, respectively; requires the appointing authority and commissioner in such proceedings to provide the complainant employee copies of certain evidence prior to meeting with the employee; excludes evidence from consideration if not so provided. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30.

2782.title: As introduced, authorizes the dean of the University of Tennessee extension to designate a person to serve in the dean's place on the state fair board. - Amends TCA Title 4; Section 5-9-102 and Title 43.
2782.description: As introduced, authorizes the dean of the University of Tennessee extension to designate a person to serve in the dean's place on the state fair board. - Amends TCA Title 4; Section 5-9-102 and Title 43.

2786.title: As introduced, requires the department of human services to request approval to require that EBT cards for food stamps have a photo of the head of household. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 3.
2786.description: As introduced, requires the department of human services to request approval to require that EBT cards for food stamps have a photo of the head of household. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 3.

2793.title: As introduced, prohibits school employees, directors of schools, and employees and members of a local board of education or governing body of a public charter school from assisting an employee in obtaining a job at another school for any position that involves direct contact with minors or students, if the school is on notice, or has reasonable cause to suspect, that the employee has committed an act of misconduct. - Amends TCA Title 49.
2793.description: As introduced, prohibits school employees, directors of schools, and employees and members of a local board of education or governing body of a public charter school from assisting an employee in obtaining a job at another school for any position that involves direct contact with minors or students, if the school is on notice, or has reasonable cause to suspect, that the employee has committed an act of misconduct. - Amends TCA Title 49.

2809.title: As introduced, authorizes a nurse practitioner or physician assistant who holds a federal DEA waiver to prescribe buprenorphine products under certain conditions. - Amends TCA Title 53.

4502.last_action: Received from House, refer to Senate Calendar Committee
4502.title: Adjourns sine die 110th General Assembly on April 25, 2018.

4503.last_action: Refer to Senate Health & Welfare Committee
4503.title: As introduced, prohibits the Board for Professional Counselors, Marital and Family Therapists, and Clinical Pastoral Therapists from adopting any rule that incorporates by reference a national association's code of ethics, including, but not limited to, the American Counseling Association Code of Ethics; revises other provisions related to allowing counselors to not counsel when doing so conflicts with beliefs. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49 and Title 63.
4503.description: As introduced, prohibits the Board for Professional Counselors, Marital and Family Therapists, and Clinical Pastoral Therapists from adopting any rule that incorporates by reference a national association's code of ethics, including, but not limited to, the American Counseling Association Code of Ethics; revises other provisions related to allowing counselors to not counsel when doing so conflicts with beliefs. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49 and Title 63.

4508.title: As introduced, classifies second degree murder and voluntary manslaughter of a law enforcement officer as hate crimes; punishes such offenses one classification higher than the classification established by the statute creating the offense committed. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
4508.description: As introduced, classifies second degree murder and voluntary manslaughter of a law enforcement officer as hate crimes; punishes such offenses one classification higher than the classification established by the statute creating the offense committed. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

4513.title: As introduced, allows any person age 65 or older to request the jury coordinator of the county to remove the person's name from the jury list of the county if the request is made in writing and is accompanied by an affidavit providing the person's name, age, and other information the jury coordinator requires; requires the jury coordinator to remove the person's name from the jury list upon receiving the request. - Amends TCA Title 22.
4513.description: As introduced, allows any person age 65 or older to request the jury coordinator of the county to remove the person's name from the jury list of the county if the request is made in writing and is accompanied by an affidavit providing the person's name, age, and other information the jury coordinator requires; requires the jury coordinator to remove the person's name from the jury list upon receiving the request. - Amends TCA Title 22.

4623.title: As introduced, authorizes a retired teacher with a minimum of 20 years’ experience teaching to receive an automatic certification or licensure for an additional 20 years or until the teacher reaches the age of 75; requires the retired teacher to purchase any liability insurance. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-821 and Title 49.
4623.description: As introduced, authorizes a retired teacher with a minimum of 20 years’ experience teaching to receive an automatic certification or licensure for an additional 20 years or until the teacher reaches the age of 75; requires the retired teacher to purchase any liability insurance. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-821 and Title 49.

4675.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
4675.title: As introduced, authorizes the state board for licensing alarm systems contractors to fill a vacancy on the board from lists of nominees submitted by interested burglar and fire alarm organizations until the governor makes an appointment if the governor fails to appoint a successor after 60 days, instead of the current 90 days, following the vacancy occurring. - Amends TCA Title 62.
4675.description: As introduced, authorizes the state board for licensing alarm systems contractors to fill a vacancy on the board from lists of nominees submitted by interested burglar and fire alarm organizations until the governor makes an appointment if the governor fails to appoint a successor after 60 days, instead of the current 90 days, following the vacancy occurring. - Amends TCA Title 62.

4681.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
4681.title: As introduced, deletes obsolete requirement that the commissioner conduct a study of impediments to insurance for the use of justifiable force and report the results of that study to the general assembly and governor no later than March 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 56.
4681.description: As introduced, deletes obsolete requirement that the commissioner conduct a study of impediments to insurance for the use of justifiable force and report the results of that study to the general assembly and governor no later than March 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 56.

4684.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
4684.title: As introduced, clarifies that any proceeding to revoke an insurance agent or solicitor's license for violating an insurance law is conducted pursuant to the Uniform Administrative Procedures Act. - Amends TCA Title 56.
4684.description: As introduced, clarifies that any proceeding to revoke an insurance agent or solicitor's license for violating an insurance law is conducted pursuant to the Uniform Administrative Procedures Act. - Amends TCA Title 56.

4685.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Government Operations Committee
4685.title: As introduced, requires an agency to provide a copy of an emergency rule prior to the rule's effective date to any person requesting a copy before such date. - Amends TCA Title 4.
4685.description: As introduced, requires an agency to provide a copy of an emergency rule prior to the rule's effective date to any person requesting a copy before such date. - Amends TCA Title 4.

4688.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Transportation & Safety Committee
4688.title: As introduced, increases from a Class C to a Class B misdemeanor the penalty for violations of provisions concerning the organization, operation, and solicitation of members for an automobile club or association. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 18.
4688.description: As introduced, increases from a Class C to a Class B misdemeanor the penalty for violations of provisions concerning the organization, operation, and solicitation of members for an automobile club or association. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 18.

4689.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
4689.title: As introduced, increases the time an alarm system contractor has to furnish the state board for licensing alarm system contractors certain identifying information regarding an employee from 30 days to 31 days from the beginning of employment. - Amends TCA Title 62.
4689.description: As introduced, increases the time an alarm system contractor has to furnish the state board for licensing alarm system contractors certain identifying information regarding an employee from 30 days to 31 days from the beginning of employment. - Amends TCA Title 62.

4691.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Government Operations Committee
4691.title: As introduced, requires an agency to provide a copy of emergency rules filed with the secretary of state to any person upon request. - Amends TCA Title 4.
4691.description: As introduced, requires an agency to provide a copy of emergency rules filed with the secretary of state to any person upon request. - Amends TCA Title 4.

4729.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
4729.title: As introduced, removes publication requirements for supplemental registrations. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 2.
4729.description: As introduced, removes publication requirements for supplemental registrations. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 2.

4823.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
4823.title: As introduced, requires the office of legislative information systems to provide members and the staff of members with access to dashboard until the member leaves office; requires the office to ensure that public access to dashboard does not violate attorney-client privilege. - Amends TCA Title 3.
4823.description: As introduced, requires the office of legislative information systems to provide members and the staff of members with access to dashboard until the member leaves office; requires the office to ensure that public access to dashboard does not violate attorney-client privilege. - Amends TCA Title 3.

4861.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
4861.title: As introduced, requires that a medical examiner make certain findings before listing suicide as a cause of death, and creates a presumption against a determination of cause of death by suicide; creates a process by which a deceased person's spouse, parent, guardian, next of kin, or estate administrator can request the medical examiner reconsider a determination of cause of death by suicide. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 3, Part 5.
4861.description: As introduced, requires that a medical examiner make certain findings before listing suicide as a cause of death, and creates a presumption against a determination of cause of death by suicide; creates a process by which a deceased person's spouse, parent, guardian, next of kin, or estate administrator can request the medical examiner reconsider a determination of cause of death by suicide. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 3, Part 5.

4909.title: As introduced, prohibits certain adverse actions against a physician on the basis of the physician's failure to maintain specialty board certification or maintenance of licensure under a framework established by the Federation of State Medical Boards. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 56, Chapter 7; Title 63, Chapter 6; Title 63, Chapter 9 and Title 68.
4909.description: As introduced, prohibits certain adverse actions against a physician on the basis of the physician's failure to maintain specialty board certification or maintenance of licensure under a framework established by the Federation of State Medical Boards. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 56, Chapter 7; Title 63, Chapter 6; Title 63, Chapter 9 and Title 68.

4920.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Energy, Ag., and Nat. Resources Committee
4920.title: As introduced, increases the minimum amount of hunter orange that big game hunters must wear from 500 square inches to 525 square inches, effective January 1, 2018. - Amends TCA Title 70.
4920.description: As introduced, increases the minimum amount of hunter orange that big game hunters must wear from 500 square inches to 525 square inches, effective January 1, 2018. - Amends TCA Title 70.

4980.title: As introduced, authorizes a law enforcement officer to refer for mental health evaluation prior to arrest a person determined to be the primary aggressor in a crime involving domestic abuse if the officer believes the person acted as the primary aggressor because the person suffers from dementia or the effects of medication prescribed for dementia. - Amends TCA Section 36-3-619 and Section 40-11-150.
4980.description: As introduced, authorizes a law enforcement officer to refer for mental health evaluation prior to arrest a person determined to be the primary aggressor in a crime involving domestic abuse if the officer believes the person acted as the primary aggressor because the person suffers from dementia or the effects of medication prescribed for dementia. - Amends TCA Section 36-3-619 and Section 40-11-150.

5002.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Education Committee
5002.title: As introduced, removes requirement that an eligible student be previously enrolled in a public school for two semesters prior to receiving an individualized education account, attend a Tennessee school for the first time, or receive an account in the previous school year in order to be considered eligible to receive an individualized education account. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 10.
5002.description: As introduced, removes requirement that an eligible student be previously enrolled in a public school for two semesters prior to receiving an individualized education account, attend a Tennessee school for the first time, or receive an account in the previous school year in order to be considered eligible to receive an individualized education account. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 10.

5042.title: As introduced, authorizes the TennCare program to provide medical assistance for language interpreter services. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.
5042.description: As introduced, authorizes the TennCare program to provide medical assistance for language interpreter services. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.

5088.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
5088.title: As introduced, corrects an error in the definition of "academic year" for purposes of the lottery scholarship program. - Amends TCA Title 49.
5088.description: As introduced, corrects an error in the definition of "academic year" for purposes of the lottery scholarship program. - Amends TCA Title 49.

5102.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
5102.title: As introduced, specifies that audio or video recording and taking photographs of a ballot with a mobile electronic or communication device is prohibited within a polling place. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-142.
5102.description: As introduced, specifies that audio or video recording and taking photographs of a ballot with a mobile electronic or communication device is prohibited within a polling place. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-142.

5144.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
5144.title: As introduced, increases the time in which a person may appeal the department of revenue seizing a person's certificate of title, certificate of registration, permit or license or license plate because the document or plate is fictitious, has been issued in error or unlawfully, contains erroneous information, or has been ordered revoked, canceled, or suspended by a court of competent jurisdiction from 10 days from the seizure to 14 days from the seizure. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 39; Title 40; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 65 and Title 67.
5144.description: As introduced, increases the time in which a person may appeal the department of revenue seizing a person's certificate of title, certificate of registration, permit or license or license plate because the document or plate is fictitious, has been issued in error or unlawfully, contains erroneous information, or has been ordered revoked, canceled, or suspended by a court of competent jurisdiction from 10 days from the seizure to 14 days from the seizure. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 39; Title 40; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 65 and Title 67.

5193.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
5193.title: As introduced, specifies minimum reimbursement rates to counties for the housing of state inmates; states that the reimbursement rate for housing state prisoners shall not be less than the following amounts per inmate per day: for the period of July 1, 2017, until June 30, 2019, not less than $42.00; and for the period of July 1, 2019, and thereafter, not less than $47.00. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 41.
5193.description: As introduced, specifies minimum reimbursement rates to counties for the housing of state inmates; states that the reimbursement rate for housing state prisoners shall not be less than the following amounts per inmate per day: for the period of July 1, 2017, until June 30, 2019, not less than $42.00; and for the period of July 1, 2019, and thereafter, not less than $47.00. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 41.

5200.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Transportatio Committee
5200.title: As introduced, makes permanent the provision allowing counties to provide 2 percent matching funds for state-aid highway funds rather than 25 percent that was set to expire July 1, 2017. - Amends TCA Section 54-4-404.
5200.description: As introduced, makes permanent the provision allowing counties to provide 2 percent matching funds for state-aid highway funds rather than 25 percent that was set to expire July 1, 2017. - Amends TCA Section 54-4-404.

5293.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
5293.title: As introduced, revises categories of patients who qualify to receive certain prescriptions of forms of buprenorphine. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 11, Part 3.
5293.description: As introduced, revises categories of patients who qualify to receive certain prescriptions of forms of buprenorphine. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 11, Part 3.

5455.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Transportatio Committee
5455.title: As introduced, increases from 10 to 15 calendar days the period of time a special permit for the movement of a motor vehicle of excess weight or size is valid for a single trip. - Amends TCA Section 55-7-205.
5455.description: As introduced, increases from 10 to 15 calendar days the period of time a special permit for the movement of a motor vehicle of excess weight or size is valid for a single trip. - Amends TCA Section 55-7-205.

5494.title: As introduced, permits a retired law enforcement officer who has been found eligible by the Tennessee POST commission to carry a firearm pursuant to federal law to carry a firearm that has been shipped or transported in interstate or foreign commerce in the same manner and to the same extent as authorized for an active law enforcement officer to carry a firearm of the same type. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
5494.description: As introduced, permits a retired law enforcement officer who has been found eligible by the Tennessee POST commission to carry a firearm pursuant to federal law to carry a firearm that has been shipped or transported in interstate or foreign commerce in the same manner and to the same extent as authorized for an active law enforcement officer to carry a firearm of the same type. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

5525.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
5525.title: As introduced, creates Class C misdemeanor of using or claiming to have a false academic degree for the purpose of obtaining an honor, prize, award, or other recognition for which a certain degree is required. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
5525.description: As introduced, creates Class C misdemeanor of using or claiming to have a false academic degree for the purpose of obtaining an honor, prize, award, or other recognition for which a certain degree is required. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

5526.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee

5526.description: As introduced, increases from 30 to 40 the number of working days in which the historical commission must review and comment on plans to demolish, alter, or transfer state property with historical significance. - Amends TCA Title 4.

5539.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
5539.title: As introduced, prohibits a commissioner or deputy commissioner who administers contracts of a department from accepting employment with a private business that contracts with the department for 12 months after the commissioner's or deputy commissioner's departure from public office. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 12, Chapter 3; Title 12, Chapter 4 and Title 50.
5539.description: As introduced, prohibits a commissioner or deputy commissioner who administers contracts of a department from accepting employment with a private business that contracts with the department for 12 months after the commissioner's or deputy commissioner's departure from public office. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 12, Chapter 3; Title 12, Chapter 4 and Title 50.

5640.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
5640.title: As introduced, enacts the "Access to Pediatric Rare Disease Treatment Information Act"; provides for sharing of essential treatment information for children with cancer among certain health care institutions. - Amends TCA Title 68.
5640.description: As introduced, enacts the "Access to Pediatric Rare Disease Treatment Information Act"; provides for sharing of essential treatment information for children with cancer among certain health care institutions. - Amends TCA Title 68.

5775.title: As introduced, creates a tax-free weekend for sales of firearms, firearms ammunition, and firearms accessories made during the same time as the annual sales tax holiday. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
5775.description: As introduced, creates a tax-free weekend for sales of firearms, firearms ammunition, and firearms accessories made during the same time as the annual sales tax holiday. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

5791.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
5791.title: As introduced, makes various changes to the process for restoration of voting rights, including requiring a felon's voting rights to be automatically restored upon release from serving a period of confinement. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 29.
5791.description: As introduced, makes various changes to the process for restoration of voting rights, including requiring a felon's voting rights to be automatically restored upon release from serving a period of confinement. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 29.

5793.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
5793.title: As introduced, allows a property owner whose property is being used as a farm to petition to remove such property from a municipality's corporate limits. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 51, Part 2.
5793.description: As introduced, allows a property owner whose property is being used as a farm to petition to remove such property from a municipality's corporate limits. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 51, Part 2.

5808.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Government Operations Committee
5808.title: As introduced, creates a task force to study the effects of concussions on student athletes in high school and college. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

5809.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
5809.title: As introduced, prohibits, with exceptions, an employer from requiring an employee or prospective employee who is a member of the Tennessee national guard or the uniformed services of the United States to waive certain rights or agree to binding arbitration of certain claims; requires a waiver or arbitration agreement executed by a service member employee to be knowing, voluntary, and recorded in a signed writing to be enforceable. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 29.
5809.description: As introduced, prohibits, with exceptions, an employer from requiring an employee or prospective employee who is a member of the Tennessee national guard or the uniformed services of the United States to waive certain rights or agree to binding arbitration of certain claims; requires a waiver or arbitration agreement executed by a service member employee to be knowing, voluntary, and recorded in a signed writing to be enforceable. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 29.

5810.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
5810.title: As introduced, directs each LEA to require students to take one year of instruction in Tennessee history between grades four through eight; requires that the curriculum be developed in consultation with the department of education. - Amends TCA Title 49.
5810.description: As introduced, directs each LEA to require students to take one year of instruction in Tennessee history between grades four through eight; requires that the curriculum be developed in consultation with the department of education. - Amends TCA Title 49.

5883.description: As introduced, provides that a woman may be prosecuted for assault for the illegal use of a narcotic drug while pregnant, if her child is born addicted to or harmed by the narcotic drug. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 63 and Title 68.

6232.description: As introduced, removes anesthesia charges related to pain relief that decreases the use of opioids from the calculation of costs for episodes of care in the payment reform initiative of the bureau of TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 71.

6243.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6243.title: As introduced, prohibits a circuit, probate, or county court or court clerk from approving a petition for a name change or correcting an error on a birth certificate until the petitioner provides proof of a criminal history record check through the TBI. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 4; Title 16, Chapter 16; Title 16, Chapter 10 and Title 29, Chapter 8.
6243.description: As introduced, prohibits a circuit, probate, or county court or court clerk from approving a petition for a name change or correcting an error on a birth certificate until the petitioner provides proof of a criminal history record check through the TBI. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 4; Title 16, Chapter 16; Title 16, Chapter 10 and Title 29, Chapter 8.

6273.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
6273.title: As introduced, reduces the fees paid in the certificate of need program by an essential access hospital under the TennCare II demonstration waiver by 50 percent. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 68.
6273.description: As introduced, reduces the fees paid in the certificate of need program by an essential access hospital under the TennCare II demonstration waiver by 50 percent. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 68.

6274.last_action: Refer to Senate F,W&M Revenue Subcommittee
6274.title: As introduced, exempts dietary supplements from sales and use tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
6274.description: As introduced, exempts dietary supplements from sales and use tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

6282.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
6282.title: As introduced, requires LEAs to submit annual report to department of education detailing the LEA's use of corporal punishment, specifically including the reason for the punishment and whether the instance involved a student with an IEP; requires the department to report the number of instances of corporal punishment and the number of instances involving a student with an IEP on its website; protects confidentality of student. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
6282.description: As introduced, requires LEAs to submit annual report to department of education detailing the LEA's use of corporal punishment, specifically including the reason for the punishment and whether the instance involved a student with an IEP; requires the department to report the number of instances of corporal punishment and the number of instances involving a student with an IEP on its website; protects confidentality of student. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

6366.title: As introduced, authorizes the City of Germantown to pursue certification of a border region retail tourism development district. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 40.
6366.description: As introduced, authorizes the City of Germantown to pursue certification of a border region retail tourism development district. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 40.

6404.title: As introduced, requires court hearing adoption to suspend proceeding if putative father or established father is served with notice of the adoption but does nothing until time court is scheduled to declare father in default; court to hold hearing within 30 days of date scheduled for adoption hearing to determine if there are grounds to terminate the parental rights of the father. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1, Part 1.
6404.description: As introduced, requires court hearing adoption to suspend proceeding if putative father or established father is served with notice of the adoption but does nothing until time court is scheduled to declare father in default; court to hold hearing within 30 days of date scheduled for adoption hearing to determine if there are grounds to terminate the parental rights of the father. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1, Part 1.

6405.title: As introduced, prohibits vacating an otherwise valid order of adoption because the order was not completed within one year of the filing of the petition. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-119.
6405.description: As introduced, prohibits vacating an otherwise valid order of adoption because the order was not completed within one year of the filing of the petition. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-119.

6413.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
6413.title: As introduced, prohibits a municipality or county from adopting or enforcing an ordinance or resolution that prohibits a property owner from displaying the flag of the United States or an official or replica flag of any branch of the United States armed forces on the property owner's property. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 5; Title 6, Chapter 54 and Title 13, Chapter 7.
6413.description: As introduced, prohibits a municipality or county from adopting or enforcing an ordinance or resolution that prohibits a property owner from displaying the flag of the United States or an official or replica flag of any branch of the United States armed forces on the property owner's property. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 5; Title 6, Chapter 54 and Title 13, Chapter 7.

6420.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6420.title: As introduced, authorizes aggrieved parties to demand a jury in judicial review of an administrative hearing under the Uniform Administrative Procedures Act and in cases for a permanent injunction or forfeiture under the Tennessee Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act. - Amends TCA Section 3-6-204; Title 4; Section 8-3-102; Title 27; Title 29; Section 36-5-1003; Section 36-5-1107; Section 37-5-514; Section 39-17-1509; Section 40-33-213; Section 42-2-224; Section 47-9-513; Section 49-1-1107; Title 53; Section 55-12-103; Section 55-17-116; Section 55-10-425; Section 60-1-401; Title 65; Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 13; Section 68-120-110; Section 68-201-116; Section 68-212-113; Section 68-212-114; Section 68-212-215; Section 68-221-714; Section 68-1-104; Section 69-3-115; Section 69-11-118; Section 71-3-510; Section 71-4-507 and Section 71-3-509.
6420.description: As introduced, authorizes aggrieved parties to demand a jury in judicial review of an administrative hearing under the Uniform Administrative Procedures Act and in cases for a permanent injunction or forfeiture under the Tennessee Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act. - Amends TCA Section 3-6-204; Title 4; Section 8-3-102; Title 27; Title 29; Section 36-5-1003; Section 36-5-1107; Section 37-5-514; Section 39-17-1509; Section 40-33-213; Section 42-2-224; Section 47-9-513; Section 49-1-1107; Title 53; Section 55-12-103; Section 55-17-116; Section 55-10-425; Section 60-1-401; Title 65; Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 13; Section 68-120-110; Section 68-201-116; Section 68-212-113; Section 68-212-114; Section 68-212-215; Section 68-221-714; Section 68-1-104; Section 69-3-115; Section 69-11-118; Section 71-3-510; Section 71-4-507 and Section 71-3-509.

6434.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
6434.title: As introduced, permits 50 percent of the real property tax collected on real property conveyed by a land bank to be remitted to the land bank for a period of five years following the conveyance. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 30 and Title 67.
6434.description: As introduced, permits 50 percent of the real property tax collected on real property conveyed by a land bank to be remitted to the land bank for a period of five years following the conveyance. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 30 and Title 67.

6435.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate State and Local Government Committee
6435.title: As introduced, extends application of the Neighborhood Preservation Act to include any county or municipality that has formed a land bank. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 6 and Title 67.
6435.description: As introduced, extends application of the Neighborhood Preservation Act to include any county or municipality that has formed a land bank. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 6 and Title 67.

6439.title: As introduced, increases number of retail package store licenses a person may have from two to six. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-406.
6439.description: As introduced, increases number of retail package store licenses a person may have from two to six. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-406.

6440.title: As introduced, increases number of retail package store licenses a person may have from two to three. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3, Part 4.
6440.description: As introduced, increases number of retail package store licenses a person may have from two to three. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3, Part 4.

6458.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
6458.title: As introduced, requires the commissioner of commerce and insurance to annually submit a report to the general assembly detailing the implementation of the enforcement plan for federal manufactured home construction and safety standards under the National Manufactured Home Construction and Safety Standards Act of 1974 and any agreements entered into with the department of housing and urban development. - Amends TCA Title 45; Title 47; Title 55; Title 56; Title 66 and Title 68.
6458.description: As introduced, requires the commissioner of commerce and insurance to annually submit a report to the general assembly detailing the implementation of the enforcement plan for federal manufactured home construction and safety standards under the National Manufactured Home Construction and Safety Standards Act of 1974 and any agreements entered into with the department of housing and urban development. - Amends TCA Title 45; Title 47; Title 55; Title 56; Title 66 and Title 68.

6536.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6536.title: As introduced, decreases from 30 to 21 days the time in which a licensed polygraph examiner or company must notify the private investigation and polygraph commission of a change in business address. - Amends TCA Title 62.
6536.description: As introduced, decreases from 30 to 21 days the time in which a licensed polygraph examiner or company must notify the private investigation and polygraph commission of a change in business address. - Amends TCA Title 62.

6571.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Transportation and Safety Committee
6571.title: As introduced, authorizes the department, in addition to the required inclusion of promotional campaign material regarding the availability of cultural, specialty earmarked and new specialty earmarked motor vehicle registration plates with motor vehicle registration renewal notices, to publish promotional campaign material on the department's website through a prominent link provided on the home page. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2 and Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 3.
6571.description: As introduced, authorizes the department, in addition to the required inclusion of promotional campaign material regarding the availability of cultural, specialty earmarked and new specialty earmarked motor vehicle registration plates with motor vehicle registration renewal notices, to publish promotional campaign material on the department's website through a prominent link provided on the home page. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2 and Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 3.

6608.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6608.title: As introduced, requires that signs used for posting prohibitions on the possessions of firearms on a premises be permanently affixed to the locations where the signs are posted. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1359.
6608.description: As introduced, requires that signs used for posting prohibitions on the possessions of firearms on a premises be permanently affixed to the locations where the signs are posted. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1359.

6640.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Education Committee
6640.title: As introduced, requires the state board of education to make meetings of the basic education program review committee available for public viewing over the internet by streaming live and archived video accessible from the board's website. - Amends TCA Title 49.
6640.description: As introduced, requires the state board of education to make meetings of the basic education program review committee available for public viewing over the internet by streaming live and archived video accessible from the board's website. - Amends TCA Title 49.

6683.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6683.title: As introduced, requires clerks of court to forward to the department of correction judgments rendered twice a month rather than once per month for purposes of calculating release eligibility. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 5.
6683.description: As introduced, requires clerks of court to forward to the department of correction judgments rendered twice a month rather than once per month for purposes of calculating release eligibility. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 5.

6775.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Transportation and Safety Committee
6775.title: As introduced, provides one registration plate, free of charge, to each qualified veteran; authorizes local governments to exempt qualified veterans from the motor vehicle privilege tax for such plate. - Amends TCA Section 5-8-102 and Title 55, Chapter 4.
6775.description: As introduced, provides one registration plate, free of charge, to each qualified veteran; authorizes local governments to exempt qualified veterans from the motor vehicle privilege tax for such plate. - Amends TCA Section 5-8-102 and Title 55, Chapter 4.

6803.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6803.title: As introduced, removes authorization for enforcement of child support obligations by means of denial, revocation, or restriction of obligor's license; requires licensing authorities to reinstate licenses previously restricted, suspended, or revoked due to failure to pay child support upon payment of a reasonable fee. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 5; Section 39-17-1351; Title 56, Chapter 1, Part 3 and Section 63-1-141.
6803.description: As introduced, removes authorization for enforcement of child support obligations by means of denial, revocation, or restriction of obligor's license; requires licensing authorities to reinstate licenses previously restricted, suspended, or revoked due to failure to pay child support upon payment of a reasonable fee. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 5; Section 39-17-1351; Title 56, Chapter 1, Part 3 and Section 63-1-141.

6843.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6843.title: As introduced, changes procedure for dispossession of firearms for persons convicted of domestic violence offense; requires that firearms be surrendered to local law enforcement within 48 hours of conviction. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Section 39-13-111; Section 39-17-1307; Section 39-17-1317 and Section 40-14-109.
6843.description: As introduced, changes procedure for dispossession of firearms for persons convicted of domestic violence offense; requires that firearms be surrendered to local law enforcement within 48 hours of conviction. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Section 39-13-111; Section 39-17-1307; Section 39-17-1317 and Section 40-14-109.

6857.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Health and Welfare Committee
6857.title: As introduced, authorizes an existing licensed nursing home to relocate beds in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16.
6857.description: As introduced, authorizes an existing licensed nursing home to relocate beds in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16.

6873.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Commerce and Labor Committee
6873.title: As introduced, requires department of safety to send person whose license is subject to suspension for failing to maintain liability insurance, notice of intent that the person's driver license will be suspended in 45 days, rather than in 30 days, for failing to comply with department's payment plan for reinstatement; extends, from 30 to 45 days following the date of such notice, the time within which the person has to request a hearing to show compliance with the department's payment plan. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12; Title 55, Chapter 50 and Title 56.
6873.description: As introduced, requires department of safety to send person whose license is subject to suspension for failing to maintain liability insurance, notice of intent that the person's driver license will be suspended in 45 days, rather than in 30 days, for failing to comply with department's payment plan for reinstatement; extends, from 30 to 45 days following the date of such notice, the time within which the person has to request a hearing to show compliance with the department's payment plan. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12; Title 55, Chapter 50 and Title 56.

6902.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6902.title: As introduced, directs TACIR to perform a study of the implementation and effects of global position monitoring as a condition of bail for defendants accused of crimes of domestic violence; requires TACIR to seek input from interested groups; requires TACIR to make a report to the general assembly at the conclusion of the study. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-111 and Title 40, Chapter 11.
6902.description: As introduced, directs TACIR to perform a study of the implementation and effects of global position monitoring as a condition of bail for defendants accused of crimes of domestic violence; requires TACIR to seek input from interested groups; requires TACIR to make a report to the general assembly at the conclusion of the study. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-111 and Title 40, Chapter 11.

6905.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, refer to Senate Judiciary Committee
6905.title: As introduced, directs TACIR to study and report on the implementation and effects of global position monitoring as a condition of bail for certain defendants; requires state departments and agencies to provide assistance to TACIR in connection with the study; requires that TACIR seek input from interested groups. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-111 and Title 40, Chapter 11.
6905.description: As introduced, directs TACIR to study and report on the implementation and effects of global position monitoring as a condition of bail for certain defendants; requires state departments and agencies to provide assistance to TACIR in connection with the study; requires that TACIR seek input from interested groups. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-111 and Title 40, Chapter 11.

6956.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Finance, Ways, and Means Committee
6956.title: As introduced, prohibits distribution of retirement benefits from defined benefit plans to nonspouse beneficiaries. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 25; Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36; Title 8, Chapter 37 and Title 8, Chapter 38.
6956.description: As introduced, prohibits distribution of retirement benefits from defined benefit plans to nonspouse beneficiaries. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 25; Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36; Title 8, Chapter 37 and Title 8, Chapter 38.

6993.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate Education Committee
6993.title: As introduced, requires the commissioner to annually report, for the preceding school year, the number of any night schools established and maintained by local boards of education to the education committee of the senate and the education instruction and programs committee of the house of representatives no later than October 31 of each year. - Amends TCA Title 49.
6993.description: As introduced, requires the commissioner to annually report, for the preceding school year, the number of any night schools established and maintained by local boards of education to the education committee of the senate and the education instruction and programs committee of the house of representatives no later than October 31 of each year. - Amends TCA Title 49.

7002.last_action: Assigned to General Subcommittee of Senate State & Local Government Committee
7002.title: As introduced, extends from 10 to 15 days the period during which a property owner may, after receiving notice from the city of excessive vegetation or debris on the owner's property, remedy the condition before the city remedies the condition and charges the costs to the property owner. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.
7002.description: As introduced, extends from 10 to 15 days the period during which a property owner may, after receiving notice from the city of excessive vegetation or debris on the owner's property, remedy the condition before the city remedies the condition and charges the costs to the property owner. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.

7199.title: As introduced, changes from 500 feet to 153 meters the distance to which the light on a motor vehicle must display. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8 and Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4.
7199.description: As introduced, changes from 500 feet to 153 meters the distance to which the light on a motor vehicle must display. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8 and Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4.

7205.title: As introduced, establishes timelines and requirements for the return of schools operated as part of the achievement school district (ASD) to LEAs; prohibits, after the effective date of the act, any school from being assigned to the ASD and the ASD from executing, approving, authorizing, or renewing any contract, charter school application, or charter agreement; abolishes the ASD as an organizational unit of the department of education on July 1, 2019, or when the last charter agreement with the ASD expires, whichever is later. - Amends TCA Title 49.
7205.description: As introduced, establishes timelines and requirements for the return of schools operated as part of the achievement school district (ASD) to LEAs; prohibits, after the effective date of the act, any school from being assigned to the ASD and the ASD from executing, approving, authorizing, or renewing any contract, charter school application, or charter agreement; abolishes the ASD as an organizational unit of the department of education on July 1, 2019, or when the last charter agreement with the ASD expires, whichever is later. - Amends TCA Title 49.

7250.last_action: Passed on Second Consideration, held on desk. Local Bill
7250.title: As introduced, authorizes the City of Crossville, by ordinance adopted by a two-thirds vote, to levy an occupancy tax of not more than 3 percent on the privilege of staying in any hotel or motel in Crossville; the ordinance must set forth the manner of collection and administration of the privilege tax; requires that all proceeds received by the municipality from the tax be used for tourism and economic development. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-1425.
7250.description: As introduced, authorizes the City of Crossville, by ordinance adopted by a two-thirds vote, to levy an occupancy tax of not more than 3 percent on the privilege of staying in any hotel or motel in Crossville; the ordinance must set forth the manner of collection and administration of the privilege tax; requires that all proceeds received by the municipality from the tax be used for tourism and economic development. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-1425.
